intro: Ateramnus ellipticus, commonly known as the narrowleaf ateramnus, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as the buckwheat family. The plant is characterized by its elliptical, lance-shaped leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs. It produces small, clustered flowers that are usually green or reddish in color. Ateramnus ellipticus is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or stream banks.
